channel.title: Interface Question (PJA)
channel.description:
Okay i just have an interface question If im changing text and the system out print when this button is clicked [img]http://i44.tinypic.com/34xkndu.jpg[/img] is like interface 274 button 16 something like that
is that the interface and button ids you would use to change [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/10qkm10.jpg[/img] that text ??
(if not how would you find the ids of the text in the box?) thx for the help :D

item.title: Interface Question (PJA)
item.dc:creator: @Crown2 Crown2
item.description:
@Crown2 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:7, topic:438873”]19237, 5608, 5

try diff combinations of that[/quote]

is the first number the interface the second the button and 3 is what can u explain what that stands for?

EDIT Found some examples in skiire’s dump
19339:5608, null, Cast on, null, Magic Dart, null, Cast on, [Action List:], interface type:5
19340:5608, null, Cast on, null, Teleother Lumbridge, null, Cast on, [Action List:], interface type:5
19341:5608, null, Cast on, null, Teleother Falador, null, Cast on, [Action List:], interface type:5
19342:5608, null, Cast on, null, Tele Block, null, Cast on, [Action List:], interface type:5
19343:5608, null, Cast on, null, Teleother Camelot, null, Cast on, [Action List:], interface type:5
19344:5608, null, Cast on, null, Enchant Lvl-6 Jewelry, null, Cast on, [Action List:], interface type:5
19345:5608, null, null, Cast @gre@Bones to peaches, null, null, null, [Action List:], interface type:5
19346:5608, null, null, Cast @gre@Teleport to Ape Atoll, null, null, null, [Action List:], interface type:5

kk ill try this l8tr so would i change it just like i would change the name of a quest or ? do i have to include the last number in it ? (im guessing yes)

Read full topic

item.title: Interface Question (PJA)
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Crown2:

yah lins cache editor dose not work and i add that command into the server ?

If Lin’s interface editor doesn’t work, I don’t know what to tell you at this point :/. That command won’t work for you without some heavy refactoring.
You can use my dump if you want, I’m not sure if the Id’s stay the same between revisions though, so you’ll just have to test it out :/. I can’t think of anything else to help you, you’ll have to ask someone smarter

http://up.ht/IpxATY

Read full topic

item.title: Interface Question (PJA)
item.dc:creator: @Crown2 Crown2
item.description:
@Crown2 wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:4, topic:438873”]To dump interfaces you just have to make a command or something of the likes to do it, this is how I have mine handled:

						if (inputString.equals("::dumpinterfacetofile")) {
							pushMessage("Dumping to file...", 0, "");
							BufferedWriter localBufferedWriter = null;
							try {
								localBufferedWriter = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(signlink.findcachedir() + "interface_information_dump.txt"));
								for (RSInterface rsi : RSInterface.interfaceCache) {
									try {
										String actionList = "[Action List:";
										try {
											for (String act : rsi.actions) {
												try {
													actionList = actionList + ", " + act;
												} catch (Exception eee) {

												}
											}
										} catch (Exception ee) {

										}
										actionList = actionList + "]";
										String info = rsi.id + ":" + rsi.parentID + ", " + rsi.message + ", " + rsi.selectedActionName + ", " + rsi.tooltip + ", " + rsi.spellName + ", " + rsi.aString228 + ", " + rsi.selectedActionName + ", " + actionList + ", interface type:" + rsi.type;
										localBufferedWriter.write(info, 0, info.length());
										localBufferedWriter.newLine();
									} catch (java.lang.NullPointerException e) {
									}
								}
								localBufferedWriter.close();
							} catch (IOException localIOException) {
							}
						}
					}

As for scan the cache, I meant manually read/scan it with your eyes. I’m not sure if you’ll run into complications because this is a higher revision cache, but try loading it through Lin’s interface editor.

1159, I believe, is the Id for the magic interface. Then go through that until you come across the spells you wish to change (should easily let you change the description).

EDIT: Those aren’t pictures, well at least the strings aren’t. There’s a picture for the background (the black) and there’s one for that frame around it. All the text you see is not a picture though, those are handled via strings and can easily be edited.[/quote]

yah lins cache editor dose not work and i add that command into the server ?

Read full topic

item.title: Interface Question (PJA)
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

To dump interfaces you just have to make a command or something of the likes to do it, this is how I have mine handled:

						if (inputString.equals("::dumpinterfacetofile")) {
							pushMessage("Dumping to file...", 0, "");
							BufferedWriter localBufferedWriter = null;
							try {
								localBufferedWriter = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(signlink.findcachedir() + "interface_information_dump.txt"));
								for (RSInterface rsi : RSInterface.interfaceCache) {
									try {
										String actionList = "[Action List:";
										try {
											for (String act : rsi.actions) {
												try {
													actionList = actionList + ", " + act;
												} catch (Exception eee) {

												}
											}
										} catch (Exception ee) {

										}
										actionList = actionList + "]";
										String info = rsi.id + ":" + rsi.parentID + ", " + rsi.message + ", " + rsi.selectedActionName + ", " + rsi.tooltip + ", " + rsi.spellName + ", " + rsi.aString228 + ", " + rsi.selectedActionName + ", " + actionList + ", interface type:" + rsi.type;
										localBufferedWriter.write(info, 0, info.length());
										localBufferedWriter.newLine();
									} catch (java.lang.NullPointerException e) {
									}
								}
								localBufferedWriter.close();
							} catch (IOException localIOException) {
							}
						}
					}

As for scan the cache, I meant manually read/scan it with your eyes. I’m not sure if you’ll run into complications because this is a higher revision cache, but try loading it through Lin’s interface editor.

1159, I believe, is the Id for the magic interface. Then go through that until you come across the spells you wish to change (should easily let you change the description).

EDIT: Those aren’t pictures, well at least the strings aren’t. There’s a picture for the background (the black) and there’s one for that frame around it. All the text you see is not a picture though, those are handled via strings and can easily be edited.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Crown2 wrote:

Skiire:

To find the string Ids for that you would have to do an interface dump/scan the cache.

i don’t know how to dump the cache but cant i just find it from already dumped caches? (cant find a 459 cache though )

if i use alex’s 569 + cache editor it loads it but i dont know how to edit the pics as its picture editor dose not work
